intro: Chamaenerion pubescens, commonly known as fireweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its erect, sometimes branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Fireweed is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in open fields. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
